pages.text: Sphenoecium is a very early, benthic, probably sessile graptolite. Several species have been described. Like all graptolites, it was a colonial organism, and was comprised of many small fanworm-like organisms each with a seperate, calcified tube to live in. Sphenoecium did not branch, but the community tubes were instead clustered from a single basal point.
